    public class CcddGroupManagerDialog
extends CcddDialogHandler

    • Method Detail

      • getEditorPanelHandler

        protected CcddInputFieldPanelHandler getEditorPanelHandler()
        Get a reference to the editor panel handler
        Returns:
        Reference to the editor panel handler

      • doGroupUpdatesComplete

        protected void doGroupUpdatesComplete(boolean commandError)
        Perform the steps needed following execution of group updates to the database
        Parameters:
        commandError - false if the database commands successfully completed; true if an error occurred and the changes were not made

      • copyGroupInformation

        private void copyGroupInformation()
        Store a copy of the group information

      • initialize

        private void initialize()
        Create the group manager dialog. This is executed in a separate thread since it can take a noticeable amount time to complete, and by using a separate thread the GUI is allowed to continue to update. The GUI menu commands, however, are disabled until the telemetry scheduler initialization completes execution

      • setGroupAndFields

        private void setGroupAndFields(java.lang.String groupName)
        Set/clear the selected group, add/remove the data fields, enable/disable the description field, and enable/disable the dialog's buttons that apply only if a single group is selected based on if a valid group name is provided
        Parameters:
        groupName - name of the selected group; null if no group or more than one group is selected

      • recreateDataFieldPanel

        private void recreateDataFieldPanel(boolean undoable)
        Update the group manager dialog's size following additions or deletions to the data field panel
        Parameters:
        undoable - true if the update can be undone/redone

      • enableApplicationCheckBox

        private void enableApplicationCheckBox(boolean enable,
                                       boolean isApplication)
        Set the enable status of the CFS application indicator check box
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the check box, false to disable
        isApplication - true if the group represents a CFS application

      • setGroupButtonsEnabled

        private void setGroupButtonsEnabled(boolean enable)
        Set the enable status of the buttons that apply only when one group is selected
        Parameters:
        enable - true to enable the buttons, false to disable

        Create a panel to contain a pair of buttons. Make all but the button icons transparent
        Returns:
        JPanel containing the buttons in a vertical layout

        Add a group name field to the dialog
        Parameters:
        fieldText - text to display beside the input field
        currentName - name of the selected group
        dialogPnl - panel to which to add the input field
        Returns:
        The GridBagConstraints used to arrange the dialog

      • verifyGroupName

        private boolean verifyGroupName(CcddDialogHandler caller)
        Verify that the contents of the group name field is valid
        Parameters:
        caller - reference to the dialog that is being verified
        Returns:
        true if the group name is valid; false otherwise

      • updateSelectedGroupInformation

        private void updateSelectedGroupInformation()
        Update the currently selected group's application flag, description, and data fields in the main group information list

      • isGroupsChanged

        private boolean isGroupsChanged()
        Check if the groups differ from those last committed to the database
        Returns:
        true if the group definitions have changed

      • ignoreFieldTableChanges

        private boolean ignoreFieldTableChanges()
        Check if the unsaved changes to an open data field table editor should be ignored
        Returns:
        true if the there are no unsaved data field table editor changes or if the user chooses to ignore the changes; false if the group has no data field changes, the data field table editor isn't open, or the user chooses to not ignore the unsaved changes

        private void updateChangeIndicator()
